name: Project
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Resource Manager.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, `google-cloud`.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as google-cloud.

The instructions below are here for reference, however, we will soon stop releasing updates to the bundled package.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var resource = gcloud.resource();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var resource = gcloud.resource({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Project
methods.description: A Project object allows you to interact with a Google Cloud Platform project.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: delete
methods.description:
Delete the project.

This method only works if you are authenticated as yourself, e.g. using the gcloud SDK.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.err

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a project if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.metadata
params.description: • Metadata of the project from the API.

This method only works if you are authenticated as yourself, e.g. using the gcloud SDK.

This method only works if you are authenticated as yourself, e.g. using the gcloud SDK.
